text: <@U104VR0MA|bruno.ciscato> has joined the channel

I also suggested in the last meeting that we set up a mechanism so that folks could self subscribe themselves as experts or interested parties based on component, feature, or function. In otherwords, if security is your thing, you could subscribe yourself either as interested or as an SME. Then as requirements on security are being scheduled for review, notifications would be sent to all individuals that are SME’s requesting them to attend to get the true experts involved, and emails would be sent to interested parties as optional attendees to listen to the discussion.
<@U0RSTB2DB>: Hi is there a meeting today?
Yes, but where is the meeting invitation?
Last week's room is an "old meeting" and can't be reused.
<!channel>: where is the meeting invite? The old meeting code can't be reused.
yea, I scrolled through here and didn’t see a new one either
<@U0UFDAS91>: maybe it is the 15th
based on the poll you saw
Friday is the Architecture meeting and Identity meeting.

Initial Hyperledger Identity WG
Fri, Apr 15, 11:00 am PT | 1 hr
San Francisco (Pacific Daylight Time, GMT-07:00)

Agenda for the first call is to introduce ourselves, focus on what can be a deliverable, and make a decision on how to collaborate asynchronously (slack, email list, etc.)

When it's time, start the meeting from here:

ok, thanks Chris
thank you, adding it to my calandar

All, the doodle poll indicates that Monday at 8AM is the best time for the Requirements WG meetings. I will get them scheduled. The next meeting will be Monday, April 18th at 8AM PDT.  As discussed, Primrose will go through the Counterfeit drugs use case.
<@U0PTU8XN3|philipdesautels> has joined the channel

<@U0VKKEGKB> kindly answered my requests to get started on a requirements document and created the following outline here. I’ve made a few small changes. There is much work to do, but it’s a start. Thanks Howard !  <https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki/Requirement-Document>

attachments.title: hyperledger/hyperledger
attachments.text: Hyperledger Project is a new Collaborative Project at The Linux Foundation. The technical community is just getting started and will be adding code to the repository in the coming weeks. Check hype...

text: My apology to <@U0UFDAS91> and all who were looking for a requirements meeting this morning. Again, the regular meeting will be Mondays from 0800-0900 PDT. I will send out an announcement as soon as the meeting service is provisioned.
<@U0RSTB2DB>: no problem, glad to help :simple_smile:
